## ​​Overview

​​Overview

A person can legally work in Australia if:

A person can legally work in Australia if:
- they are an Australian citizen or
they are an Australian citizen or
- they hold a valid visa with permission to work.
they hold a valid visa with permission to work.

You must check you are employing someone who can legally work in Australia. Some visa holders can work unrestricted, others can work a limited amount, while some cannot work at all.

People who can prove they are either an Australian citizen or an Australian permanent resident can work unrestricted. This is in line with Australian employment law.

## How to hire someone

How to hire someone

Follow these steps to hire someone in Australia.

Follow these steps to hire someone in Australia.

Step 1

Step 1

Check if the person is an Australian citizen. You can read about how a person can prove theirAustralian Citizenship.

Australian Citizenship
.

Step 2

Step 2

If the person is not an Australian citizen, check if they are an Australian permanent resident by asking to see:

If the person is not an Australian citizen, check if they are an Australian permanent resident by asking to see:
- their overseas passport
their overseas passport
- evidence the person holds an Australian permanent visa.
evidence the person holds an Australian permanent visa.

To check if someone holds a permanent visa, useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO).

To check if someone holds a permanent visa, use

Step 3

Step 3

If the person is not an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident, check they have a visa with work entitlements.

If the person is not an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident, check they have a visa with work entitlements.

A person's visa will say if they cannot work. To check, you can:

A person's visa will say if they cannot work. To check, you can:
- ask the person to email you their current visa details fromVEVO

VEVO

VEVO will tell you:

VEVO will tell you:
- the visa grant and expiry date
the visa grant and expiry date
- whether the person has work entitlements.
whether the person has work entitlements.

If there are no work restrictions on their visa, the person has unlimited rights to work in Australia.

If there are no work restrictions on their visa, the person has unlimited rights to work in Australia.

Hire someone only if:

Hire someone only if:
- their visa is in effect
their visa is in effect
- the conditions do not say 'No work'
the conditions do not say 'No work'
- they will not breach any other visa conditions
they will not breach any other visa conditions
- their visa has not expired or been cancelled
their visa has not expired or been cancelled
- they are allowed to do the type of work you want them to.
they are allowed to do the type of work you want them to.

A visa holder must not work more hours than their visa conditions allow.

A visa holder must not work more hours than their visa conditions allow.

These things are not enough evidence by themselves that a non-citizen can work in Australia:

These things are not enough evidence by themselves that a non-citizen can work in Australia:
- Medicare card
Medicare card
- tax file number
tax file number
- drivers licence.
drivers licence.

Step 4

Step 4

Make sure your employee has a valid work visa for the whole time they work for you. Check their visa within 2 days of expiry or if you know their visa circumstances have changed. If they hold a bridging visa and VEVO does not show a visa expiry date, you should check their visa every 3 months to ensure they still have work rights.
